channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description:
Everyone should read Elie Mystal's new book https://t.co/NIW6n1rnXC If you think you understand the Constitution, you probably don't.
Another way to look at it.
If we're going to do the 2022 midterms right, we should have people campaigning who really understand the stakes in the election, not just in an emotional way, with real substance behind the urgency.
For that, I'd make Mystal's book required reading.
To @jayrosen_nyu -- I saw in your feed that you'd like to do bootcamps for newsrooms about the threat to democracy in this election.
Maybe the necessary precursor is doing bootcamps for voters. Imagine if this was the summer of learning about democracy in America.
These Are the 46 Ski Resorts Still Open in North America. https://t.co/p2wAUsMXum
Well finally a new episode of Better Call Saul tonight. Predictions. 1. Lalo will survive. 2. Kim Wexler will end up working for Lalo or maybe vice versa. 3. And Saul hooks up with Mr White.
Why Does Elon Musk's Potential Twitter Takeover Scare the Media So Much? https://t.co/u0sD78lkZY
Underprescribing opioids can also cause harm. https://t.co/8IVR4xvbWY
@lmorchard I have run the tape "Insert contact lens" when I was supposed to be taking out the contact lens. I actually put the second one on top of the one that was already there.
@jayrosen_nyu Another theory is that this is where the news is happening and turning away from twitter would be like a journalist of the 80s turning off their phone.
@mhp surprisingly so. but somehow it works anyway.

@KenSmith what's the alternative? and why would you think the billionaire would be cavalier with evolving the product or service? i assume you're talking about musk. what in his background makes you think he would do something reckless?
@KenSmith nothing about any of this is at equilibrium. remember we're using up the ability of the planet to support human life. things cannot stay as they are.

@mjgraves @wa8dzp that's absolutely true. and gets to the point, that to be able to evolve a system like twitter, you have to know how to make software *and* how people use it. without both you're wandering around going nowhere.
You know the old question -- if a troll trolls in a forest and no one's listening are they still trolling? The answer is no.

I didn't know Tucker Carlson actually had testicles.
I'm not saying he doesn't. Just I've never seen them. Have you?
@davidpots yes
@JoeTrippi I hear they're adding testicle tanning to Florida math textbooks.
Masha Gessen: 'Everything that is on Russian TV is a lie.' https://t.co/RBdAuhhO47
Wordle 303 4/6 游릳游릳拘럻릴拘 拘럭샢拘럻릴拘 拘럻릴拘럭샢拘 游릴游릴游릴游릴游릴
Flying With Weed: TSA Marijuana Rules Explained. https://t.co/ekMVSooUTK
Kamala Harris Talks to The Ringer About Her Wordle Habit. https://t.co/hcCQe91QFv
Crypto Industry Helps Write, and Pass, Its Own Agenda in State Capitols. https://t.co/ItqTouVT0r
If someone on Twitter says something that bums me out, I unfollow and mute them.

It's absolutely true, and actually even worse. When you add up everything they have in motion, they're trying to turn the country back to pre-Civil War norms. In other words, slavery. https://t.co/jdwsPdYY3h
That's what they mean when they say they're "originalists" -- they think the pre-abolition enslavers should still rule the US. Which means slavery.
Somewhere someone is reading yesterday's Scripting News which just went out via email two minutes ago.

From watching Severance twice, I now know why, when Helly goes out through the exit, trying to escape, she immediately comes back through the same door she went out from. It wasn't metaphysical. There's a simple explanation for it.
Testicle tanning to be removed from math textbooks in Florida. https://t.co/ezQxL1FOXg
